item.name: General - Blackbird diskstats plugin is sending data

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - I/Os currently in progress
item_prototype.description: The only field that should go to zero. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate request_queue_t and decremented as they finish.

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - milliseconds spent doing I/Os
item_prototype.description: This field is increases so long as field 9 is nonzero

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - milliseconds spent reading
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all reads (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - milliseconds spent writing
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all writes (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - reads completed
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of reads completed successfully

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - reads merged
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of reads completed Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - sectors read
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of sectors read successfully

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - sectors written
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of sectors written successfully

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - weighted milliseconds spent doing I/Os
item_prototype.description: This field is incremented at each I/O start, I/O completion, I/O merge, or read of these stats by the number of I/Os in progress (field 9) times the number of milliseconds spent doing I/O since the last update of this field. This can provide an easy measure of both I/O completion time and the backlog that may be accumulating.

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - writes completed
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of writes completed successfully

item_prototype.name: Statistics - {#DISKNAME} - writes merged
item_prototype.description: This is the total number of reads completed Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

trigger.name: General - Blackbird diskstats plugin is not sending data
